alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 24 at 4:55AM PST until January 26 at 6:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet expected, with local sets to 8 feet. Highest surf will be on west-facing beaches in southern San Diego County. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From this afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Large waves and strong rip currents will create hazardous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will peak on Wednesday and lower slightly on Thursday. Elevated surf may continue into the weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
